name: Company Career Page
description: Candidates who applied directly through the company's dedicated careers website. Typically the highest quality and lowest cost source.

name: Internal Referral
description: Candidates referred by a current employee. Often results in the fastest hires and best culture fit.

name: LinkedIn
description: The professional networking site used for job postings, passive candidate sourcing, and recruiter outreach.

name: Indeed
description: A global job aggregator and job board, frequently one of the largest sources of high-volume applications.

name: Glassdoor
description: Used by candidates to research company reviews and compensation; often features job postings.

name: Recruitment Agency / Headhunter
description: Third-party firms specializing in sourcing highly specific or executive talent, usually used for hard-to-fill roles.

name: University/Campus Career Fair
description: Candidates sourced from specific college or university events, commonly used for entry-level and internship roles.

name: HackerNews / Tech Forums
description: Specialized job boards or community forums targeting niche technical audiences (e.g., specific programming languages or open source communities).

name: Google Jobs
description: Candidates discovered through Google's job search feature, which aggregates listings from various sites.
